I'm using windows and python 3.     import urllib.request import cv2 import numpy as np  url='http://00.0.00.000/html.mjpg' url='http://00.0.00.000/html/cam_pic_new.php?time=1539220838541&pDelay=40000'  while True:     imgResp=urllib.request.urlopen(url)     imgNp=np.array(bytearray(imgResp.read()),dtype=np.uint8)     img=cv2.imdecode(imgNp,-1)     cv2.imshow('test',img)     if ord('q')==cv2.waitKey(10):         exit(0)

author: @slipthetrap
text: Cool info, thanks.  I've been learning python from your videos, thanks again, and coded a simple setup to capture an image on the raspberry pi and stream it straight to a web browser (not stored on sd card): https://github.com/cleesmith/picamera_to_browser raspberry pi camera photo streamed to a web browser Of course, what you just demo-ed is cooler.
